page.title: 10Housing in Palehouse Common
page.content: This is a quiet, rural area with about 100 inhabitants. Most of the area consists of the High Cross Estate but there are a few privately owned houses. The land is used chiefly for grazing but some smallholders cultivate their own land. About 25 of the properties belonged originally to the estate. Each house still bears the family crest and the word 'persevere'. Some residents whose spouses worked for the owner still pay one pound a week rent as set down in his will. These buildings are brick with tiled roofs with leaded lights or wooden framed windows. Extensions have been made to many of the homes. The peace and the slow lifestyle attract people to the area and properties sell quickly. Prices are around Â£30,000 for a three bedroomed cottage.
